body: Hi, I have a question, what do we not use ```JVM-container```？
/run e2e
@hanahmily According to https://builds.apache.org/job/skywalking-e2e-2/2131/console, the OAP can't startup. Could you recheck whether this works locally?
When I checked with another PR's console, https://builds.apache.org/job/skywalking-e2e-2/2132/console. The test env seems works, even the OceanBlue somehow is not working well.

Got it. I'm gonna take a look

@kezhenxu94 It cannot skip as we expected. Could you help me？

@wu-sheng I tested it out locally because ci keeps failing.

/run e2e
/run ci
/run e2e

Our storage APIs are open, if you have any proposal about how to implement those, we are glad to discuss the detail. @dmsolr is working on the prototype of using MySQL(or other traditional DB) + Influx DB to as a new storage option.
@cyejing The CI env shows strange error, so please check this locally, after https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/3952 done, this should be tested on GitHub Action directly.

> Hi, I have a question, what do we not use `JVM-container`？

original tests cases use tomcat, so i follow. @arugal

It looks like this webflux plugin can replace the previous webflux plugin, right? You can delete the previous webflux plugin in this pr. Please note that the gateway may be affected, and operationName you can change, in the previous testcase.
Thanks for the pointers! I and @dlazerka will look into how to add storage backend plugin for VictoriaMetrics.

> @kezhenxu94 It cannot skip as we expected. Could you help me？

It looks like Action does not support GIT Command.

We have a document to show you the interfaces. After yoh read the design, consider to start from https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/storage-extention.md

We may have more interfaces listed there, but basic ideas are same.

@cyejing  Jenkins jobs have been disabled, please add your tasks to GitHub action file, and fix the conflict, remove the Jenkins file. https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/.github/workflows/plugins-test.yaml

ok.
works like this: Using mysql as storage, I'll verify elasticsearch later.

> > Hi, I have a question, what do we not use `JVM-container`？
> 
> original tests cases use tomcat, so i follow. @arugal

As  I have moved to JVM container. Beacause tomcat met some problems.
I think ELK could provide a good UI for this, why do you want SkyWalking do this?

> it should be more appropriate to put them together。

Does the ` webflux plugin` & `gateway plugin` together in one `optional plugin `? Sound not good to me. First of all, from the perspective of `jar dependency`, micro-services will be divided into two types: `webflux application server` and `routing gateway application server`. Second, the webflux plugin should focus on responding to external requests, while the gateway should focus on routing that is, including external forwarding

@zhaoyuguang  You're right. ``spring cloud gateway`` is divided into two types. receive request and routing request.  receive request is based on webflux .  routing request have two components are optional. 
https://github.com/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-gateway/blob/master/spring-cloud-gateway-core/src/main/java/org/springframework/cloud/gateway/filter/NettyRoutingFilter.java
https://github.com/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-gateway/blob/master/spring-cloud-gateway-core/src/main/java/org/springframework/cloud/gateway/filter/WebClientHttpRoutingFilter.java
Actually only ``reactor.netty.http.client.HttpClient`` is work. ``WebClient`` config is commented
So if you divide by types, Is it possible to add a ``reactor.netty.http.client.HttpClient`` plugin.
What do you think

It is very sad to tell you that you need to update the Action configuration (resolve conflicts) because those are updated after #3956 merged. Maybe you need to move it to another group which is faster.
And the test failed (Tomcat-container doesn't need to pack it as a ZIP package. )
@wu-sheng @cyejing How long will it take for this commits to be merged into the master branch?This modification looks good

> Actually only `reactor.netty.http.client.HttpClient` is work. `WebClient` config is commented
> So if you divide by types, Is it possible to add a `reactor.netty.http.client.HttpClient` plugin.
> What do you think

Currently, `reactor.netty.http.client.HttpClient plugin in SkyWalking gateway plugin` is no generality, if can take out the component that was too good

> Currently, `reactor.netty.http.client.HttpClient plugin in SkyWalking gateway plugin` is no generality, if can take out the component that was too good

agree, and  `SkyWalking gateway plugin`  will create `gateway own span`  if  no need  routing request and stop at `gateway filter`。  so  take out the component is better
It is almost not affected.
I will review this today.
I verified es6 and es7 and found no problem.
I submit a new pr to handle the gateway, and take out ``HttpClient`` component
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25969983/69849225-12167c00-12b7-11ea-85d8-32703e4a9b94.png)
If you want trace, you could use zipkin or jaeger receiver, plus zipkin-es or jaeger-es storage.
Duplicated, we are trying to locate and improve the plugin.
English only.
@kezhenxu94 CI fails.
@Fine0830 Apdex PR merged, we will update the demo env soon. Then you could it to add apdex at service dashboard page.

> @Fine0830 Apdex PR merged, we will update the demo env soon. Then you could it to add apdex at service dashboard page.

noted, thanks.
Cases fail, please recheck.
Do you really have two instances of projectB?

> Do you really have two instances of projectB?

Yes.
Skip successfully.

First, codes look good enough, but I also prefer others could review too. @kezhenxu94 Do you have time to do this?

@arugal For you, I think you need to update a document about storage extension. https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/storage-extention.md. I think you add new APIs, could you run and check whether we miss other APIs?

> Why not add skip condition to the other checks

Because I required the `required check`. In GitHub Action, if skip happens, it never shows as passed :)

> @arugal For you, I think you need to update a document about storage extension. https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/storage-extention.md. I think you add new APIs, could you run and check whether we miss other APIs?

I will check.
@wu-sheng @kezhenxu94  Need to update the e2e test?

> Need to update the e2e test?

Yes. We should. But maybe after @kezhenxu94 basic code review?

Alarm rule could be changed by Dynamic Configuration, including DCS(gRPC), ZK, or other config centers. You could read this, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/backend/dynamic-config.md
Follow the document please, make sure you set the time and TZ matched among the target application, OAP server and browser.

1. Because jdk8 support is required, the general use of webflux is jdk
2. It may be because of moving the directory. Most of the content is the same.Modified operationName
Are your plugin codes using JDK8 class? Could give me an example? The target codes are not related. If Your plugin could be compiled in 1.6, keep it in that way, rather than optional plugin.

> Are your plugin codes using JDK8 class? Could give me an example? The target codes are not related. If Your plugin could be compiled in 1.6, keep it in that way, rather than optional plugin.

for lambda. reactor method parameters are lambda interface. Example ``Mono `` ``Flux ``
Plugin code use:
```suggestion
        return ((Mono) ret).doFinally(s -> {
```
works like this:

> It is very sad to tell you that you need to update the Action configuration (resolve conflicts) because those are updated after #3956 merged. Maybe you need to move it to another group which is faster.
> And the test failed (Tomcat-container doesn't need to pack it as a ZIP package. )

ok, I am using jVM container. May be i lost some files. i will check then submit again.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.
Jenkins is not there any more. We are working out with Apache why those are still there.
You should add MySQL As a separated group in that test case, named As MySQL case like others.

> In testcase the operationName: GET:/provider/b/testcase,
I think GET: is not necessary，

I support to keep `GET` in the OP name prefix. Because in rest scenario, it could be `GET: abc/123` and `PUT: abc/123` for different meanings. It is better to keep them separated in endpoint metrics analysis.
